Thanks for your pull request. The automated tests will run as soon as one of the admins verifies this change is ok for us to run on our infrastructure.

`CMakeLists.txt` is generated from `templates/CMakeLists.txt.template` and `build.yaml`. We need to move the change to these files, and generate `CMakeLists.txt` with `tools/buildgen/generate_projects.sh`.
@y-zeng Ah, I'm not as familiar with the gRPC setup. Would you be able to make that change?

```
[trickle] No significant performance differences
```

```
[microbenchmarks] No significant performance differences
```

To remove `grpc` in `grpc++_unsecure`, we'll have to revert #11247. But it was the fix for #10909.
@yang-g @nicolasnoble Could you please take a look?
Based on the discussion in #11247, it seems like the problem was repeating symbols in C and C++, not specifically about grpc vs grpc_unsecure; maybe it was collateral damage?

To clarify, does this issue arise only with cmake or also with Bazel? Because I notice that the PR that @y-zeng referenced didn't actually change the Bazel BUILD file but only the build.yaml file used by make and cmake.
Thanks. I'm working on combining the salient features of whatever PRs you throw my way (#11933, #11944, and #11962 in particular)

We may need some larger change to support this (or just change the cmake template as a workaround).
Maybe forking the grpc++_base with an unsecure version or something.
Assigning to Nico to look deeper.

Yeah, that was what I was thinking also. Going to talk to Nico this
afternoon. I have bits and pieces of a solution.
